greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the divisors of n reduced modulo n.
comment: If a(n) = 0, then n is a multiply-perfect number (A007691). - _Alonso del Arte_, Mar 30 2014
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537 (first 1000 terms from T. D. Noe, terms 1001..20000 from Alois P. Heinz).
mathematica: Table[Mod[DivisorSigma[1, n], n], {n, 80}] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Mar 30 2014 *)
program: a054024 n = mod (a000203 n) n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 23 2013
results.author: Asher Auel (asher.auel(AT)reed.edu), Jan 19 2000
